POLYHEDRAL is an interview book, wherein the interviewer has spoken to different people who work in the Tabletop Roleplaying Game (TTRPG) industry. Whether they have made their own independent system or made supplements to existing ones, work primarily as a freelancer or own their own company, all people interviewed have been given time to talk about themselves, their story and their work.

Inside the pages of POLYHEDRAL you'll find passion, camaraderie, troubles, hardship, and joy in what each designer shares. Within these pages you'll find conversations — between one creator to another — where the person behind the books and projects that so many have come to love, adore, and use are given the focus so that they may talk about themselves and the context of their work. These conversations are transcribed into text, and done so in a way to preserve the tone and spirit that each person brings. In the words presented in this book, it is hoped that you will see an image of their soul.

POLYHEDRAL is, at its core, an 11" by 11" book that is currently estimated at around 150+ pages. A digital PDF and screen-reader friendly file will also be available.

A few reasons.

The first is that I made a joke on Twitter that got severely out of hand.

The second is that often times when a creator in this industry is interviewed, it is strictly about their most recent project or what they are currently working on, or as part of a panel to get their insight and perspective on a certain narrow field. Rarely do they get to talk about themselves or how they came into this industry, or about their experiences working in this industry.

The third is that I worked on my own TTRPG book and ran into some troubles and experiences that I couldn't have prepared for. You can't truly prepare for life, and there's no book that can prepare you for the unique stress of making these books. My goal is to make a book that can help prepare people for the stresses of making these books by giving them some measure of forewarning, but also to reassure that they can make what they envision as well.

I'm Joshua Mendenhall, also known as HTTPaladin. I'm a freelance graphic designer, writer, and game designer. I specialize in narrative design. You can find me on Twitter where I talk about game design, media, and life. You can also find me on Instagram, but I don't do anything there, so you'd be going there for nothing.
I'm offering a book that measures roughly 11 x 11 inches big. There is a Standard Edition and then there is a Collector's Edition. The Collector's Edition has a faux leather cover with gold foil.

Shipping is collected in the backerkit.

Collector's Edition Cover
Only a sticker, pin and a print currently. Should the appropriate stretch goals be unlocked, this section will fill out with more add-ons. Add-ons may be added in the pledge tier, or in the add-ons selection screen after choosing your tier. This is really important. Some tiers already include add-ons, but you may still add add-ons after selecting a tier. If you select a tier that already has, say, a book and a pin, and you add a pin in the add-on page, you're going to be getting two pins. If you select a tier that has a book and a pin, and you add a print, you're going to be getting the same as if you had gotten a tier that has a book, a pin, and a print.
2" tall sticker.
A black and white, 1.5" tall pin of the skull used on the covers
Thank You Credits
This add-on was added due to feedback from others. It is here if you wish to have your name included in the book as a Thank You, and is entirely optional. If enough people get this tier, I'll even make a pretty word skull.
In a state of rushed panic I just started using a skull on a business card back in GenCon 2019, and using skulls and skeletons for my own has just become a thing that I do. I also figure I won't have another book that I can just use a skull for and be satisfied, so if not now, when?
The business card. In person, its reflective gold on black. Digitally, its somewhat garrish.
